citation.article-title: Ignisphaera aggregans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel hyperthermophilic crenarchaeote isolated from hot springs in Rotorua and Tokaanu, New Zealand.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Ignisphaera (Ig.ni.sphae′ra. L. n. ignis fire, L. fem. n. sphaera ball, N.L. fem n. Ignisphaera fire ball).
Cells are regular to irregular cocci that occur singly, in pairs or as aggregates.
Electron acceptor is not absolutely necessary.
Elemental sulphur and NaCl inhibit growth.
The 16S rRNA gene groups within the Crenarchaeota.
Habitat is terrestrial, near-neutral hot springs and mud pots.
The type species is Ignisphaera aggregans.
